post.desc:
The view must be absolutely magnificent up there.

I think Koyane might have been a bit confused there. 'Cause È≥• is bird, but crow/raven would be ÁÉè. Yes, it's a difference of one horizontal line. ü§î Or maybe "crow" is a misunderstanding in-universe, and there are other bird types in there too? Can you imagine, a **seagull tengu?**

Kamidana is basically a home shrine, and... huh, some Christians have it too.

Side door is kinda weird. The original word is "Kitchen Door", and the definition itself hinges more on the fact that it's a secondary door for utility instead of the main entrance, and it isn't necessarily always located at the back of the house (hence, it's not always a "back door").

Before the iconic sliding doors, there were the shitomi. Yeah, they're shutters, but they also count as doors if you can remove the bottom panel. And it's a Heian period thing... so Byakuren's time.

"Ventilation" also doubles as "communication" within an organization. So if your office has bad ventilation... you get the idea.
